column1: fuller, pushed across and a bit of shape into the left-handed Zaman who pushes back off the inside part of the bat
some movement again. This time it isn't pushed across as much. On a length around middle and drifts down the leg side
full on off, pushes with hard hands and the ball nips in to off the inside part of the bat to midwicket
some shape away this time, on a length and nipping outside off, Shehzad gets behind the line and blocks solidly off the backfoot
full on middle and leg and straightening a tad, clipped to midwicket
length, some movement away outside off, left alone
beaten. Back of a length, pitching around off and Shehzad sticks the bat out before the ball jags away to leave him beaten
short and wide, slashes hard through the covers.Two fielders give it a chase and one of them slides forward to flick it back to the other
fullish, cuts in sharply from outside off, defended
flicked into the leg side
fullish, outside off, presses forward and punches to the covers
length ball, cones into him, flicks it into the midwicket region
back of a length, sharply comes into him again and he stands tall and punches down the pitch
appeal for lbw. Heading down leg. Pitches around middle and leg and curves in to ping the pad
length ball on middle, punched to midwicket
short, wide, cut hard off the backfoot to the left of point. Slower, so that messed up his timing
that's a poor delivery. Horrific line, on the leg stump, and it's a back of a length, allows the batsman to easily flick from off the pads through backward square leg
length ball, coming in on middle and off, drops it in front of mid-on for a quick single
back of a length, nips away slightly, susses out the movement and plays very late to punch it to point
length ball, on the pads, flicked to square leg
shuffles across to cover the line of this delivery that's pushed across and blocks down the pitch
short of a length, pitches outside leg and is angled across, tucked across the line around the corner
back of a length, comes in from outside off, blocked

this is what happens when you don't turn the strike over. Desperate move by the batsman, inching to get off the mark. Advances down the track and swipes hard for a flick through the on side. Finds the inside part of the bat and lobs it up for a sharp catch by square leg
short of a length outside off, punched bang off the middle of the bat to the covers
back of a length, uses the angle into him to flick behind square on the leg side
short of a length, punched back
closes the face of his bat to this delivery outside off and pops a heading edge that goes just wide of gully. Not too far away from the fielder
short of good length, nips away, punched to covers off the backfoot
fullish and shapes away, pushes forward and steers to third man off the outside part of the bat. That's the length to be bowling with that sort of movement
back of a length, angling in on off from around the wicket, punched firmly to covers
short of a length, opens the face and dabs it to point
short, wide, punched off the backfoot to the right of deep backward point
back of a length, pitching outside leg and comes on around middle and off, wristily punches to mid-on
short of a length, flays it with too hard hands and mistimes it to mid-off
fuller outside off, drives it down the ground but not off the middle because of the movement. Dots are building again

he releases some of that pressure. Skips down the track early to try and minimise the swing. But he didn't make an effort to go towards off as he did so. The ball is pushed across and as a result he doesn't find the middle as he slaps it down the ground. Sheer power, however, carries the ball to the boundary
fullish length, some movement, defended off the outside part of the bat
fullish and holding its line outside off, left alone
length, flicked to midwicket who dives and saves what could have been a boundary
fullish, nipping away, presses forward and the ball takes the outside part of the bat towards third man
full, outside off, slower ball, pushed out to mid-off
late movement outside off, left alone
fuller, outside off, swipes across the line and finds the inside part of the bat as the ball goes to midwicket
length, outside off, shuffles across and defends
full, holding its line outside off, drilled hard to mid-off
back of a length, outside off, flicked to mid-on
short of a length outside off, defended off the backfoot to the covers
full on off, carved out as he brings the bat down in the nick of time
yorker but down the wrong line, it's a leg-stumpish line and Zaman jams the bat down and squeezes it out between the boots
full, outside off, driven hard to mid-off
too full and too pacy but down the leg side and misses the flick of the batsman
full, around off, booming drive but straight to covers
too close to the body to be playing that shot. Attempts a slash with a half-angled bat and chops it into the ground in front of off stump
length ball, coming into him, tucked behind square to deep backward square
short ball, it's slower so he mistimes his pull to deep square leg
short, down the leg side, it's a nothing delivery, really, and Zaman leaves it alone
short of a length around off, punched down the pitch off the backfoot
shortish, pulled away but without timing to deep backward square. Again goes too hard at it
full on the stumps, defended
shot. That's a supreme straight drive. Full outside off and he simply leans forward and caresses it to the left of the mid-on region
short of a length, angled in, walks forward and gets outside the line to flick it through backward of square leg
short, wide, flayed hard to point

Dananjaya makes a huge appeal for caught-behind. Given a wide by the umpire but the bowler is supremely confident and urges his captain to go for the review. Loopy length ball, pitching on middle and spinning in. Babar tries to flick and the ball goes to the keeper. Ultra-edge seems to suggest that there's no nick
full, flicked to the leg side
was that off the bat? Yes, the umpire think so. sharp turn into the pads, Babar flicks it fine, seemed like it may have grazed the pad for a moment
fullish, defended off the front foot
that's a sensational stop at midwicket. Fuller, spinning in, flicked hard to midwicket who dives full-length to his right and makes a brilliant stop
full and quick, defended
shot. Shorter off-cutter, ramps it over the empty cordon. On the bounce to third man
what a shot! Back of a length, outside off, gets on top of the bounce and whips it hard from the crease. Supple wrists and powerful at the same time
short ball, gets under it easily
back of a length, nipping in, flicked to deep square leg
short, swivels around and pulls. Not entirely in control of it, gets a top-edge that goes through fine leg
short of a length, punched to long-on
full, spinning away outside off, driven down to long-off
advances down the ground and drives out wide of mid-off. Takes him on for a sharp single and completes it well
loopy, pitching on middle and leg and turns and climbs outside off to leave him beaten

huge appeal for leg before and it's optimistic more than anything. Actually, on second thought, it might be a bit close. Gets down for a reverse sweep and the ball hits the pad. Seemed like it may have missed leg. But it has straightened from the middle and leg line. Replays actually show that the ball hit the bottom part of the glove and not the pad. Is what Chandimal seemed to suggest
short, some turn away, shifts back and uses the depth of the crease well to slash a cut through backward point
full, quick, defended
flicked into the leg side
length ball, angling on middle and off, drops it in front of the covers for a quick single
short, wide, cut to point
short of a length, punched off the backfoot back to the bowler
back of a length, drifts down the leg side
back of a length, comes on dead straight, punched equally straight back to the bowler
short of a length on the pads, tucked to deep backward square leg
back of a length ball, pitches around off and he backs away to make some room to cut. But the ball spins in a mile to completely tuck him up
non-turning leg-break, not picked by the batsman who stays in the crease and gets an inside edge
flicked to short fine leg
back of a length, waits for it to spin away and opens the face of his bat to steer to the right of short third man
full on middle and leg, punched hard down the ground but the non-striker fails to get out of the way
full on the stumps, pushed down to long-on
whips this length ball from middle towards deep midwicket. Exhibits his strong bottom hand again
punches this short of length delivery straight to mid-on. Timed that beautifully

slower and fuller delivery, forced down to mid-on as they scamper a single. There's a direct hit at the striker's end, they try to sneak one of the richochet, but the striker had covered significant ground after crossing the crease. Would've been hard for him to turn back
slower length ball on middle and leg, worked to deep backward square leg
slower and fuller outside off, punched to sweeper cover
looks to whip this square on the leg side, ball thuds into the thigh pad and deflects to the off side
shaped to slog this across the line over deep midwicket, the ball nearly skewed to cover off the toe end. Was through with the stroke too early.
this one's a slider from around the stumps, Zaman somehow manages to bring his bat down in time to keep that out
the slog sweep to perfection this time. Dananjaya has been punished for too much flight. Down on one knee as he belted this over wide long-on. 82-metre hit. Stunning

You beauty, Dananjaya. Knocked him over by beating him in the air and off the pitch. This time it's the googly, Fakhar is drawn forward but didn't get to the pitch of the ball. Also made the mistake of looking to play legside, but the ball spun away ever-so-slightly to beat the outside edge and crash into the off stump. What guts it takes to once again flight the ball up nicely knowing you've been smashed off the previous delivery.
drift and spin back in from off stump, he lunges forward and turns this to the legside
flipper that skids on quickly after pitching on length around middle, bunted back to the bowler
makes room and punches this length ball to cover
pushed through quicker on off stump, punched back to the bowler
too full and drifting into middle and leg, squeezed back to the bowler who stops it on his followthrough
makes room and steers this with the spin to backward point
touch flatter and shorter from wide of the crease, punched against the turn to long-on
flicks this full delivery on the pads to deep square leg
clean strike. Down on one knee, under the flight and the sweep from off stump. Controlled stroke, bisected deep square and deep midwicket. Played it with the spin too.
punched to wide mid-off where Lakmal puts out a tumbling stop to cut that off
googly which he drives to mid-off, quick single taken
right to the pitch of the ball as he eases this to mid-off again, Lakmal caught napping as they stral another single
makes room and crunches this short ball into the gap at deep point. Huge boundary that side, acres of open space and he picked the gap well.
drills this straight to cover, good stop by Chandimal
lunges forward and defends the tossed up delivery back to the bowler.
makes room and bunts this into the gap at cover for a quick single
nice flight, Babar stretches forward and smothers the spin
slider on middle and leg, worked with the angle to deep square leg
shaped to play a slog sweep but changed his stroke and drove this back to the bowler instead
driven with the spin to extra cover
looks to step out but the bowler shortens his length, thuds into the thigh pad.
tucked into the gap between short fine and square leg
whips this shortish delivery down to deep midwicket
makes room and punches this to deep point
straight and clean. Down the pitch, not entirely to the pitch of the ball but went through. Timed it beautifully. Long-off and long-on were simply watching each other
worked with the spin to long-on as he jogs the single
drift and turn to beat the outside edge. He was drawn forward but completely deceived. Squared up completely.
too full outside off, driven with the spin to sweeper cover
forced into the deep cover region again
slider that comes back in with the arm to cramp him for room, worked wide of square leg
driven back to the bowler, whippy stroke, good stop off his own bowling
lunges forward and turns this down to long-on. That's the 100 raised for Pakistan.
touch short on middle, punched to long-on
nice flight, he's well forward in defense
too short and punished. Rocks back, opens up the leg side and pulls this into the gap at deep midwicket. He's rolling along smoothly so far. Nothing slow about his effort so far
slow turn off the surface, makes room and punches this back to the bowler. Through with the stroke too early
in-drifter that has been turned to midwicket
swept towards deep backward square leg with the angle
eased with the spin to Chandimal at extra cover
short and he's hammered this into the deep midwicket boundary. Picked the length early and belted this away. Sitting up nicely for him to execute the stroke. Sparkling stuff
too full on the pads, flicked wide of midwicket
leading edge to the off side. Closed the bat face too early
squared up by sharp turn from length. Beaten.
eased with the spin to extra cover
drifting into middle and leg, tucked to square leg
too full on middle, squeezed back to the bowler.
opens his wrists up nicely to steer this between backward point and short third man
makes room and eases this inside-out to cover
punched back to the bowler
full and drifting into middle, eased to long-off
googly that breaks back in sharply, makes room and punches this wide of cover
eased into the gap between cover and point. Slow turn from length on off, enough time to pick the gap
played really late. Waited for this to turn away and then lent direction to ease this behind point
driven inside-out to Lakmal at sweeper cover
plays with the bat well in front of the pad as he squeezes this to cover
stunning. Too full, Hafeez opens up the off side by clearing his front leg and lofts this cleanly over cover. Bullet hit to the boundary.
tossed up on middle and leg, Babar leans forward and blocks
dropped at midwicket. Tough, tough chance. Babar rocks back and pulls. Chandimal moved spontaneously to his left, jumped as well but lost control of the ball as he fell down.
drifting into the pads, tucked wide of square leg
full and sliding into the pads, flicked to deep backward square leg
eased back with the spin to the bowler
bottom-edges a slog sweep to square leg. Wanted to heave this over midwicket from way outside off
sharp turn from off stump, punched to deep cover
too full on off, eased straight to cover
driven straight to cover. Lucky to get away with this full delivery
steers this straight to point. Thrimanne is extremely alert

saved by the thinnest of inside edges. Wrong choice of stroke, nevertheless. Too full and drifting in, he went for the sweep but played a touch too early. hat would've crashed into middle of middle otherwise.

saved one delivery, gone the next! This is a long hop from the bowler, Hafeez rocked back and pulled this from outside off towards long-on. Shaped to hit it towards deep midwicket but was done in by the bounce on this delivery. Thisara at long-on hared to his right and was on the move as he held on.
drills this low full toss down to long-off
cleverly done. Well forward as he taps this towards short cover for a quick single
in-drifter from around the stumps, punched to cover
driven with the spin to long-off
superb stop by Tharanga at short fine leg. Fired down leg, he paddled this nicely
lunges forward and drives this straight to cover
pushed through quicker on middle, bunted back to the bowler
sharp turn away, he lunges forward and eases this wide of cover
on the shorter side this time, punched down to long-on
nice drift, lands this on middle, hint of turn from there, solidly defended by Malik
could have pulled but this was too wide outside off that he decided to play the late cut instead. Exceptionally done, used the bowler's pace to steer this. Picked the gap beautifully
googly which he whips from leg stump to deep square
whipped straight to midwicket
shuffles across and turns this to short square leg for a quick single
full delivery drifting into middle and leg, tucked to square leg
drifting into middle and leg, wrists this into the gap between deep square and deep midwicket
nice stride forward as he defends this with soft hands
punched to Chandimal, who fires a rocket throw to the keeper
makes room and punches this down to sweeper cover. Seventh ODI fifty

appeal for caught behind, wide signalled though. Looked to paddle this short delivery. Dickwella is soon turning into a keeper who can't be trusted with his appeals. Goes up for everything. In all fairness though, this time there was some glove. He went up to his captain immediately. No review available because he wasted one earlier
worked with the spin to square leg
turned with the spin to square leg
slow turn from off stump, pushed to point. Wanted a single but is sent back
lunges forward and eases this back to the bowler
wrong'un on middle, turned to short midwicket
picked the bones out of this. Akila at wide long-on sprinted around the ropes but he had no chance. This was hit really hard. Picked the length early, that was the key to his execution
driven wide of cover
driven with the spin to sweeper cover
punched down to long-on
drives but gets a thick outside edge that races past short third man
wrists this shortish in-drifter from off towards square leg
he's sent this deep into the stands at long-on. Jumped out of his crease and teed off like a golfer. Got underneath the flight and nailed this. Super hit. 100th six in ODIs
eased with the spin to cover
too full on middle, driven down to long-on
gets a good stride forward and drives to cover

flatter one on middle, turned towards the man coming in from deep midwicket. Siriwardena was a split-second late in moving. So even though he made good ground, he was beaten for being a second or two late
delicate little dab past short third man. Not too wide but he still somehow managed to manufacture room and eased it superbly. This is a fine exhibition of street-smart cricket
cross-seam length ball on off stump, defended to cover
looks to whip this square, gets a thick inside edge onto his thigh pad. They scamper through for a single
strong wrists and bottom hand as he whips this to deep square leg
hint of width, steered down to square third man
sways out of this short ball outside off, pacy one too
whips this across the line to wide mid-on for a quick single
full on middle and leg, driven out
short of a length and sharp turn away, sticks the bat out and pushes to get an outside edge to third man
slider on leg, clipped to square leg for a super-quick single
length ball, turns away, leans back and opens the face really late for a dab to third man
backs away to make himself some room and hammers a cut to the sweeper cover region. The fielder at deep extra cover has to move across and they take him on for a second, a quick extra run
sliding back of a length ball on middle and leg and turning away, backs away and punches wide of long-off
back of a length, just outside off, another easy dab down to third man
short of a length, not short enough, hammers a pull straight to midwicket
back of a length outside off, steered to deep backward point for an easy single
fullish length ball on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
shortish, pulled hard but slaps it straight to deep midwicket
full on leg, pushed out to mid-on
short of good length, outside off, punched to point

full, in his swinging arc and he picks it up from outside off to give it a good whack over long-on. They go upstairs to check if it has carried. Might have just landed inside. Yes, it has. Marginally so.
short of a length, late dab down to third man
fullish and some width, reaches out for a slap to deep backward point
full toss, driven square to deep backward point
fullish length, reaches out again for a slap to third man
full on off, carved away to long-off
full on middle, straightens around that line, kept out down the pitch
gets one on the full and slogs it from one knee down over midwicket
length ball, straightens around middle, drops it into the pitch
advances down the ground and hammers it past the left of the bowler. Long-off gets around it
another loopy full toss on leg, driven down to long-on
full toss outside off, driven gently and point intercepts it with a dive to his right
just over extra cover. Chips it just to the left of the fielder there. Full, wide outside off, reaches out and carves it away
short, wide, steered to third man
full and wide, too wide, and it looked like a wide, to be honest. The ball's outside the popping crease but to be fair to the umpire, Babar had moved towards off
full toss outside off, whipped between long-on and deep midwicket
shortish, outside off, pulled off the backfoot to deep midwicket
spins away from middle and leg, clumsily drops it into the off side for a single
fullish, outside off, pushes into the covers for a single
length ball, sliding on leg and turning away, guided to point
slider on leg, very full, squeezed out off the inside part of the bat back to the bowler

Was that a stumping chance missed? Malik advances and it's on a length, so Malik can't get to the pitch, Spins between his bat and pad and gets away from the keeper. Tough chance, but could it have been effected, you wonder
slower back of a length ball, pulled behind square and Lakmal makes a clumsy effort at short fine, lets the ball go through his legs
short of a length, punched wide of long-on
short of a length, slow, fetches a pull from outside off and drags it to long-on
almost chopped on. It's just luck that has ensured he's stayed on. No other way to put it. Looks to fetch a pull to one that doesn't get up and gets an inside edge perilously close to the stumps
slower full ball, clipped to midwicket
short and wide, cracked off the backfoot and point dives to his right to stop clean
short ball, pulled from outside off to deep midwicket. They hare back for the second and there's a direct throw at the bowler's end. Comfortably in
backs away and the bowler follows him with a fullish length ball, the batsman tries to flick and wears it on the pad
short of a length, swivels and pulls to long leg
extremely full on middle and leg, presents the full face and pushes it down to long-on
short of a length, gets behind the line outside off before whipping to midwicket
back of a length, whipped to deep midwicket
short of a length, uses the angle into him to whip to deep midwicket. Fifty for Malik
slower ball, backs away to force a cut, through with the shot way too early and the ball goes from mighty close to off-stump
full, outside off, carves a drive uppishly to long-off
low full toss, flicked between long-on and deep midwicket for a brisk two
short of a length, punched to sweeper cover
dipping fuller ball outside off, eased down to long-on
short of a length, jumps back and punches down to long-on
full, outside off, pushed down the ground
yorker on middle and leg, squeezed out between deep midwicket and long-on. Another well-run two
short of a length, stays in the crease and hammers a pull over midwicket
backs away and the bowler tries to follow him and sprays it down the leg side
full toss, drifting down. That's some tripe from the bowler. Easily flicked off the pads through backward of square leg
backs away again and that's much better from the bowler. Doesn't overcompensate with the line. A length ball on middle that is steered through the covers
full toss, slogs it hard but doesn't find the middle as the ball rolls along to midwicket
dipping fuller ball on middle and leg, clipped along the ground to deep midwicket
that's a tremendous hit. Floats it up outside off and dips late. Malik doesn't bother moving towards it, stays leg side and frees his arms to hammer it over extra cover
fuller ball, comes forward and drives through extra cover

shoddy effort in the deep. Malik gets down for a slog and the ball dies in front of the boundary. Deep midwicket casually moves back with his left hand half stretched and lets the ball land behind him and cross the boundary

fuller ball, pushed down the ground. Chandimal runs to his left from long-on and slides across. Jams the right knee into the turf pretty hard but does well to recover and hold on to the ball and make a clean stop
slow, dipping fuller ball, clipped to deep midwicket
full on middle and leg, whipped away to deep midwicket
backs away and crunches a drive but straight to cover. Lets out a cry of anguish as he completes the single
yorker outside leg, gets the front leg further outside and digs it out through square leg
back of a length, flicked behind square

Malik has holed out to deep midwicket. Won't get the century but what a knock! Short ball, rolls his fingers over it. It's an offcutter that doesn't quite come on. Malik hammers a pull straight into the hands of the fielder
full, clipped off the pads to deep midwicket
slower full ball, lack of pace leaves the batsman with little to do apart from pushing it gently back
another slower ball, just 95 kph, backs away to flick it to midwicket
full, flicked into midwicket, and that's the century, gets there with a single and acknowledges a rousing ovation from the crowd. Performs the sajdah and soaks in the applause

flicks across the line. This lack of pace has got to be frustrating for Pakistan. Good bowling from Perera. This one's a knuckle ball, wide outside off, Sarfraz reaches out and looks to heave it over the leg side but gets an edge that lobs in the air and settles into the hands of the point fielder inside the circle
low full toss, flicked from outside off to midwicket and he keeps strike

backs away and the bowler follows him. Babar flicks it to deep backward square leg and Babar hares back for an almost non-existent second. Absolutely sprints back and it seems like he may be gone. But tell you what, he's well in. Outstanding running

goes for a slog and it's the slower ball. Babar gets his timing all wrong. and it's a tired shot, looks to heave it over deep midwicket. Ends up dragging it to long-on who sprints forward and snaffles it
comes down the track and the bowler sprays it down the leg side. Imad misses the flick and they sprint back for the second as the keeper nails a direct hit and the ball deflects away
yorker on leg stump, tries to dig it out and inside-edges to the pad
short of a length, backs away and slaps to cover
backs away, makes room and hammers a pull to this short ball, on the bounce over deep midwicket
skips down again and the bowler fires a full toss into him that has been flicked into midwicket
full, wide, tries to stay leg side and swings hard, misses
full, wide, launches it over the in-field, stays away and swings as the ball lands in the deep backward point region
full on the stumps, heaved from off the toes over long-on. Brute power and exquisite timing
length ball, angled across with a lack of pace, slaps it hard to long-off
that's an error in judgement from Dananjaya at sweeper cover. Full, wide, keeps the front leg inside and lofts it over cover. Dananjaya runs to his left and over-runs as the ball gets past him
skips down the track and Perera has taken this out of his reach. Swings hard and misses
slides a length ball down leg, first runs on the board for Sri Lanka
touch short, he hops into the crease and steers this down to square third man
touch short and sliding into middle and leg, tucked to short midwicket as they scamper a quick single
cross-batted heave to an incoming length ball, gets a thick inside edge down to deep square
jags back in to shave past the inside edge. Kept a touch low as well. Sarfraz fumbles on the half-volley, but may have saved his side three runs. Moved in a long way after it passed the batsman
punches this back of length delivery to backward point
length delivery on off stump, pushed to cover point.
back of length delivery that moves away from off stump, left alone. This one zips through to the keeper
width and put away with a touch of disdain. Too short, Tharanga stayed back inside the crease and flayed this between cover and point.
closer to the off stump, much fuller in length as well, Tharanga is squared up as the ball whizzes past the outside edge
away-swinger from outside off, left alone
full and shaping away from off stump, Tharanga is half-forward as he bunts this back down the pitch

short-arm jab, and boy, he's belted this or what. Wasn't entirely in control it looked when he met the ball, but that was just a perception. Flew off the blade. Beauty of the stroke lay in the weight transfer. He was cramped for room alright, but went through and got full value
cut into half. This one comes back in late to beat Dickwella's feeble push
mishit but will get two. On the shorter side again, looks for a full-blooded pull but got it off the bottom part of the bat. More elevation than distance as well
smashed on the up but on the bounce to extra cover
slower delivery, he heaves this from outside off and clears midwicket. Didn't bother running, stood up and kept admiring his stroke. Tharanga urged him to run. Didn't matter in the end

third man has made a mess of it. Nearly carried. This one dipped on Malik, who was in an awkward position. This was off a thick outside edge. Went flat and just bounced in front of him. He was looking away just as the ball descended on him and that didn't help his cause.
works this into the gap at short midwicket
thick edge that flies past where a second slip would've been. Races to the third man boundary.
whips this incoming length ball into the gap at square leg. Fine leg comes in to cut that off

pokes at a delivery that nips away ever-so-slightly and gone. This length ball just zipped away off the deck, Dickwella had to play because the ball initially angled in. He was caught on the crease, squared up and found the nick. He didn't even wait for the umpire to give his decision. Walked.
slides one across Chandimal, who pokes and gets a thick inside edge to square leg
defends this incoming full-length delivery from the crease
forceful cut attempted, length not there. This one's much fuller. Rolls off the outer part of the bat to short cover
thick outside edge, on the bounce to Shahzad at slip. Gathers it well on the bounce
slower and fuller delivery across the left-hander, defended with soft hands
width and he slaps this straight to extra cover. Should've picked the gap. Boundary opportunity missed
much straighter at length, turns this from middle to short midwicket
driven through the line to extra cover. Solid
threads the gap. Beats cover point and point. Opened the bat face just a wee bit as he pressed forward to meet the ball. Lovely timing, but the outfield is on the slower side
back of length delivery sliding away, defended to the man coming in from cover

late inswingh has done the trick. Chandimal plays all around this length ball and is struck on the pad. Looked out at first instance. Replays confirm this pitched on middle and it would've crashed into middle and leg. Sri Lanka have lost their review. Poor one too.
solidly defended from the crease. Two slips waiting for the nick
cracking delivery. He's giving this a proper rip. Beaten comprehensively by a length ball that snaked away to shave past the outside edge
shows the full face of the bat in defence of this incoming length ball
stands tall and punches this length ball to cover. Wicket maiden
mistimes a forceful drive to extra cover
slaps this back of length delivery straight to point
cramped for room as this length ball angles in to thud into the bat.
deep into the crease as he bunts this length ball to cover
slices this nearly to cover point. Looked to hit it towards mid-on, the ball curved away late
angles back in from wide of the crease, turned to square leg
floats this full around off from wide of the crease, defended from the crease when he would've been better off playing forward
mistimes a cut to cover point. Once again not much movement back and across
full and angles back in just a wee bit after pitching, Tharanga is solid in defence
whipped over midwicket. Just fractionally short, he got into position early and brought out his powerful wrists into play to pick it over midwicket. Delightful timing
slower delivery on middle, turned to the leg side as the bowler scrambles to stop the single, can't
flicked uppishly over the infield. Loose ball on the pads, balance and timing all in sync. That should make Thirimanne feel much better
nearly chipped this straight to cover. Checked his shot
drifting into middle and leg, turned to square leg
sliding down leg, tickled towards short fine leg where Raees pulls off a sliding stop. Good effort, considering he's just bowled four overs full tilt
squared up, done by in the turn. Thick edge to slip where Shahzad is alert as he stops it on the bounce courtesy a dive
lunges forward and blocks
hint of drift in and turn, defended gently to the off side
back of length delivery angling away, defended solidly
slides a length ball across Thiri again, bunted gently
uses the bowler's pace to steer this away-going length ball to third man
back of length ball angling away, defended
thick inside edge that shaves past leg stump. Looked to pull but the ball skidded away of the turf. Had to fetch it from way outside off as well
leans forward and drives this straight to point
slides back in to beat the inside edge. Would it have crashed into leg? Pakistan don't think so. They don't review Good decision too.
struck on the pad again, played for the turn but this slid back in. Angle would've taken it down again
slow turn from off stump, eased with the spin this time to long-off
too full, nearly yorker-length, squeezed back down the pitch
driven with the spin to deep point. Played this late
leans forward and eases this full delivery to short cover

shuffles across and punches this length ball into the gap at midwicket. The man coming in from the deep - Raees - was late to pick it. Despite that, a direct hit would've been curtains for Tharanga. He was so slow to turn
stylish drive, but straight to the fielder
works this full delivery from off stump to mid-on
gets on top of the bounce and helps this skiddy short ball down to fine leg
full but far too wide for the batsman to have a dink at that. Easy call. Hasan is wiping the ball with a towel. Dew setting in.
slower length ball, dabbed to point
forceful drive but straight to Azhar at extra cover. Moved with the stroke to cut that off
slider from around the stumps, turned to short midwicket
steps out and caresses it with the spin to cover
straightens after pitching, defended back to the bowler
steps out but the bowler shortens his length, fires it in too, padded away. Stifled appeal but he was more than three meters out
slider that comes back in with the arm to cramp him for room and thud into the pad. Impact was outside leg

done him in. This was on the cards. Tharanga wasn't sure whether to slog sweep or pull, in the end he got into a tangle against this slider that came back in to crash into middle stump. You could sense this was coming, Hafeez worked him over superbly. If ever there was a case of someone deserved a wicket today, this was it.
back of length ball coming back in from around the stumps, this one skids in and keeps low. Rolls off the bottom half of the bat
steers this short of length delivery down to square third man
slower and fuller outside off, Thri check drives to sweeper cover.
slower and fuller just around off, squirted to the off side
slides back in from wide of the crease, pushed to mid-on
drifting into middle, he lunges forward and defends
drifts in a long way to get a tickle down leg, keeper can't move across in time. Tough one, really. Races to the fine leg boundary. Welcome runs
forced to deep point
skiddy delivery outside off, pushed back to the bowler
shuffles across and works this full delivery to short midwicket. Would've been a dead duck had he missed it
eased with the spin to long-off
angles a length ball across th eleft-hander, who bunts it gently to the off side
solidly defends this length ball to the man coming in from point
square drive, the man at point gets a hand on it to take the pace off. This was timed beautifully
back of length delivery just outside off, defended from the crease
short outside off, but this bounces way over the batsman's head. Rightly called wide

the short ball has done the trick and it's the pace of Hasan. Skiddy bouncer on off stump, Kusal plays the pull, but this reared up on him quickly to take the top edge. Sarfraz moved to his left to take a dolly. Sri Lanka in trouble

suckerpunches Siriwardena with a beauty. This length ball reverses back in just a wee bit, pitches at length and straightens. He plays down the wrong line and sees the ball crash into the stumps. Hasan is on a hat-trick
back of a length, punched back to the bowler
full on middle, clipped away to square leg
fullish, on leg stump, tucked behind square
length ball, tucked to short fine leg
flighted on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
makes some room for a back of a length ball and punches to point
full, outside off, and Perera has crashed this through the covers. Uppishly driven but has found the gap so no problems
back of a length, wily angle into the off-stump. Fired from wide of the crease so it still comes on a fair distance away from the batsman and he sticks his bat out to get beaten
fullish length ball, a nothing chip that barely clears the in-field on the off side
short ball, goes over leg stump and the arched back of the batsman
full and angling in towards off, pushed out to the covers
short ball, gets under it as the ball lobs over middle and off
slider on middle and leg, defended
very full on leg, pushed out to the off side
short of a length, fired flat and keeps slightly low, punched to long-off off the backfoot
length ball, curves in on middle and off, stays back and punches solidly to mid-off
length, on middle, shuffles back and whips it out to midwicket
flat, short of a length and some turn away, drops it to cover and takes off for a sharp single. Direct hit could have made things interesting
extremely sharp turn, pitches outside off and grips and spins away a mile, not bothered with by the batsman
full slider on leg, clipped away to midwicket
short, spinning away outside off, laces a cut to the left of point
pitched up outside off, driven squarer of the sweeper cover fielder who moves to his right and gathers it
sliding length ball, tucked off the pads to square leg
full, driven away square for a single
pitched up on middle and off, pushed to mid-off
short of a length, shifts back and whips it down to long-on
full, spins away outside off, drops to covers
slider on middle, defended back to the bowler off the inside of the bat
floats it up invitingly outside off, Perera eases into a drive to long-off
short of good length, shifts back and makes himself some room, punches it out through point
short of a length, sliding towards leg, swivels and pulls it away behind square
short, spinning away, cut to cover
slider on middle and leg, spins away sharply to come on outside off, climbs a bit on the batsman as well as he knocks it back from the crease
loopy and fullish on off, defended on the front foot
short of a length and spinning away, places a cut wide of point
fullish outside off, punched to sweeper cover
fullish, straightens around off, defended
fuller ball, pushes it out gently towards point
length ball on middle, stays back and wristily whips it out to deep midwicket
back of a length, shifts back and punches back off the inside part of the bat
full on middle, turned away to the on side
back of a length, punched off the backfoot to the off side
full, loopy and angled in towards off, pushed out to the offside
loopy length ball, straightens outside off, defended
full and sliding down leg, clipped off the pads to deep backward square leg
full on off, pushed to point
shuffles back and across and punches to point
misfield at cover-point. Cut off the backfoot and Babar misses a straightforward stop. Gets an earful from the captain Sarfraz
pitched up on middle, defended
advances down the ground and meets the pitch before launching this straight down the ground. Ball thuds into the sightscreen
back of a length, straightens off the middle stump line and Perera punches down to long-on
full, slider on leg, pushed out to long-on
full, tossed up outside off, pushed back off the inside part of the bat
short and wide, chops a cut to point as the ball refuses to get up
very full on middle, drilled back
short, straightens on middle and leg, pulled to deep square leg
non-turner on leg stump, tucked off the pads to deep square leg
full on the pads, flicked into the leg side
slider, across the off-stump and spinning in towards it, flicked through square leg
length, pitches on leg and misses the batsman's attempted flick to drift down the leg side

is that a clean strike? No, it isn't. Faheem Ashraf snaffles a stunning catch, running back from midwicket. Flighted on middle and off, Perera tries to loft but doesn't get close to it, and as a result, does not get on top of the bounce. Skies it and Ashraf runs to his right to take a wonderfully-judged catch
length ball, spins away defended with an open bat face to point
pitched up on off, defended down the pitch
pitched up on off, blocked
length ball, drops to cover and there's slight hesitation on the single. Dananjaya is sent back from halfway down but makes it back
pitched up on off, defended
full, outside off, drilled back off the inside part of the bat
full, pushed across around middle and off, clipped away to midwicket
full and pushed across, driven down to long-off
googly, on a length and straightening around off, defended with an open bat face to the off side
low full toss, whipped away to long-on
full, outside off, pushed into the covers
floated up outside off, driven through the cover and point region. Two fielders give it a chase and one of them dives but the ball beats him into the boundary
length, curving in on off and straightening, pushed back
attempts a flick but the ball lobs in the air off the pad. Sarfraz charges forward but the ball lands in front.Was there bat involved? There were shouts of catch
full, outside off, driven to cover
pitched up and angled in on off, driven back off the inside part of the bat

gets down for a slog sweep and that's a fairly well-controlled shot. Right off the middle and along the ground throughout. Deep point sprints to his right and dives to cut it off. Ahmed Shehzad the fielder
full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
length, spinning in, tucked into the leg side
short of a length, the batsman shifts back for a tuck but the ball spins down the leg side
back of a length, spinning in, pulled away to deep midwicket
slider across off, finds the outside part of Dananjaya's bat as it goes to backward point
fullish, spinning in, may have knocked it on to the pads there as there was an appeal for lbw. But definitely bat involved
pitched up on off, pushed back
length, spinning in from outside off, taps it into the leg side
short, skips back and hammers a pull through deep midwicket. Deep square leg charges to his right and makes a brilliant, diving save
full, flicked off the pads to short fine leg and they set off for the single straightaway. Fifty for Thirimanne
loopy tossed up ball on middle, clipped away to long-on
fullish outside off, punched to long-off
short of a length, punched to mid-on
shortish, keeps a little low outside off, slashes a cut to point
full on middle, pushed back
backs away to this back of a length ball and opens the face of his bat to point
length, spinning in, flicked to short fine
full, spinning in, flicked to midwicket
full on the stumps, pushed down to long-on
length ball, no turn outside leg stump, pulled to square leg

Raees has been brought back and he strikes first ball. Wonder why Sarfraz didn't do this earlier? That's a top delivery. Short of a length, cuts in sharply. Thirimanne is pinned to the crease as the ball hits the pad plumb in front of middle and leg
back of a length, whipped to the on side from outside off
full, driven to point
full, angles in towards middle at pace, pushed straight back to the bowler
back of a length, gets a bit of nip away, slower in pace and the batsman finds the outside edge as it runs down to third man
short of a length, punched to cover
pitched up outside off, pushed along the ground to long-off
tossed up too much, a full toss that has been pushed down to long-on
non-turning length ball around off, pushes back and keeps it out
full, spins away a little outside off, driven out to cover
length, spinning away, punches out to point
outside edge, flies past the slightly wide first slip. Sharp turn, sticks the bat out and gets a healthy nick that runs down to third man
short, outside off, jumps to ride the bounce and pats it to point
back of a length, cuts in, off the inside edge to square leg
short of a length, defended off the backfoot
back of a length, punched through covers
full toss, tries to heave and gets it off the inside part of the bat to midwicket
short of a length, steered to point with an open bat face
short of a length, nips in, punched off the backfoot
short, wide, cut away to sweeper cover
full, outside off, crunches a drive to point
short ball, going down leg and over the hunched back of the batsman
full, dipping outside off, pushed out to the off side
short, wide, slapped off the backfoot
full toss on middle and off, clipped away to mid-on
fullish outside off, pushed back down the pitch
length ball, presses forward early and wears it on the glove as the ball takes its time in coming on. It's the cutter
length on off, punched solidly to mid-off
short, wide, slapped off the backfoot through backward point. Brings up the 150 for Sri Lanka
short of a length, opens the face and punches to point
full outside off, driven through the right of mid-off and beats him comfortably
full, bang on the stumps, inside-edges to the pad as he comes forward and pushes
short ball, pulls but not too far away from the short midwicket fielder, beats him despite him diving to his right
full, angled in at middle, clipped away through midwicket
full, clipped hard off the pads through the left of mid-on
short ball, gets on top of the bounce and flicks it into the leg side
short ball, jumps back and defends off the backfoot
too fulland down the leg side, clipped away through midwicket
short ball, outside off, arches back and pats it through backward point
short of a length outside off, defended
short ball, tries to pull and gets a glove on it as it lobs behind the stumps. Sarfraz comes forward and bends but the ball drops short
short, wide, slapped to sweeper cover
short ball, this is bad bowling. Not going to trouble the batsman with the short ball at this pace. Dananjaya arches back and ramps it over the keeper
full on middle and leg, pushed back
pushes this length ball hard back to the bowler without moving his feet
full, reaches out for a drive and gets beaten
pitched up outside off, pushed down the ground to long-on
appeal for lbw. Sliding on leg stump and beating the batsman's flick to hit the pad. Would have missed leg
extremely full, caressed into the leg side from off the pads
full outside off, squeezed to deep point
floats a length ball outside off, steered straight to point
check-driven to mid-off. The ball held up just a little
yorker length, just outside off, squirted to point
back of the hand slower delivery on middle from wide of the crease, he picked it off the hand and defended with soft hands
pulled away. Swivelled back and fetched it from way outside off. He was hitting it towards the longer boundary and the ball stops just near the ropes
full on the stumps, driven back using the full face of the bat, long-off comes around to cut that off
slider on leg stump, tucked to square leg
slow turn from outside off, bunts this to the leg side
sees the flight, gets to the pitch of the ball and creams this to sweeper cover
slider from around the stumps, forced into the off side
drifts in towards middle, punched to long-on
leans forward and drives to cover
hint of turn from off stump, steered straight to point
too short, he slaps this past the diving point fielder.
slow turn from back into middle, defended with soft hands.
lunges forward and works this with the spin to short midwicket
hint of flight, steered to short third man
nice flight, tries to get the batsman driving but Vandersay is happy to defend from the crease
slides this down leg, paddled to fine leg
heaved from outside off towards cow corner
drifts into middle and leg, forced to deep midwicket
looks to play a delicate little dab past short third man but is beaten by slow turn
fired full and wide outside off, driven to sweeper cover
drifts away to flick the pad and lob to short third man
sharp turn this time as he fires this in quickly, eased to short third man
works it with the spin to short fine leg
swept from middle towards deep square leg
drives this full delivery straight to cover
sees the flight, eyes light up. Goes for a big hit but can only hit it as far as long-off, all along the ground too
slow turn from middle, defends from the crease
deceived in flight, somehow manages to get an inside edge to square leg
loopy delivery on the stumps from wide of the crease, defended to the leg side
muscled into the gap between deep square and wide long-on. Got to the pitch of the ball and smashed this with the spin
too short, enough time to work this wide of square leg, poor running though. Should've been a single
lunges forward and defends this to the leg side
length on middle and leg, tucked to deep square
picks the slower ball early, holds his shape and pulls this into the gap at deep midwicket. The man from deep square came around and then dived over the ball.
hit high on the back pad as he looks to work this across the line to the leg side.
lofted but this just eludes mid-off. Wasn't in control of the stroke whatsoever
low full toss which he turns from outside off towards midwicket
clears his front leg, and slaps this short-arm jab towards wide long-on. Pakistan coach Mickey Arthur can't believe what he just saw
thick inside edge down to fine leg. Played down the wrong line, the ball reversed back in late
skiddy bouncer, Dananjaya is on his toes as he fends this uncomfortably to the offside
angles it down to third man. This was another disconcerting bouncer on middle
slower and fuller on middle stump, defended to the leg side

has he gloved this bouncer? Yes. This is a stunning short delivery that veers back in from wide of the crease, Vandersay looks to sway out of the way initially but then decides he has an opportunity to perhaps ramp this over the keeper. Unfortunately he was caught in a tangle as the ball brushed his glove on the way through to Sarfraz. He was off balance as well as the ball closed in on him.
another short ball that angles in to hit him on the glove as he looks to sway out of the way. This one didn't lob up though.
back-of-the-hand slower delivery at length on middle, defended
makes room and bunts this slower ball to point
yorker-length on middle, works this down to deep midwicket
angles in a full delivery on middle from wide of the crease, blocked
looks to smash this back over the bowler's head, toe-ends this instead
high full toss on the stumps, looks to go downtown, gets it high on the bat. Down to long-on
looks to smash this over midwicket, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad. This was a length ball so he didn't get anywhere underneath that as he attempted the cross-batted swipe
deceived by the slower one. Much fuller on length, he was backing away to go over cover
picks this short ball well. Hammered from outside off to the wide long-on boundary. Dananjaya's wait for a maiden ODI fifty continues
thick inside edge on an attempted slog to deep square leg. Wanted to go over long-on again. Dananjaya walks to the striker's end.

there's the fifty. Looked to clear his front leg and pull this skiddy bouncer but could only get some bat on it as it rolled no more than a couple of yards away. He scampered through even as Hasan hared across to prevent it.
slices this full delivery down to third man courtesy a misfield at point. Pakistan now have their fifth successive ODI win
